name: Cock-a-doodle Debt
pitch_line: Rooster brooches and pins date back to ancient times, with the rooster signifiying vigilence and bravery. They grew especially popular in the late 19th century and later.

items.name: Rooster Brooch
items.description: Approximately 2.25" long. Ready to peck your eyes out, with style.

items.name: Rooster Brooch
items.description: Approximately 1.75" long. You wish you had swag like this bird.

items.name: Rooster Brooch
items.description: It's giving Foghorn Leghorn made Liberace. 1.7".

items.name: Rooster Brooch
items.description: Bring on the mixed media. 3". Might haunt your dreams.

items.name: Rooster Brooch
items.description: I'm loud, I'm colorful, and I am oddly proportioned. 2.5"

items.name: Rooster Brooch
items.description: What a tasteful and stately rooster. 2.25"

items.name: Rooster Brooch
items.description: I think this elder statesman of a rooster may need a meal or 3. Someone feed that bird. Size not listed.

items.name: Rooster Brooch
items.description: Now THIS is a fine feathered fowl. Plump. Colorful. Coming for you. 2.8"

items.name: Rooster Brooch
items.description: Someone called this monotone fellow Art Deco. I'll just give you that odd information. 1.4"

items.name: A Pair of Pins
items.description: These two pins have names. They are sold as a set: Mr. Rooster and Mrs. Hen. Each 1.5".
